ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Trial number for punishment trials.
First-stage choice selection for punishment trials.
First-stage choice reaction time (in seconds) for punishment trials.
First-stage stimulus onset time (in milliseconds) for punishment trials.
First-stage choice onset time (in milliseconds) for punishment trials.
Determination of which planet is presented.
Notes: 2 = one set of planets; 3 = a different set of planets; 888 = missing

ElementDescription: Second-stage choice selection for punishment trials.
Second-stage choice reaction time (in seconds) for punishment trials.
Second-stage stimulus onset time (in milliseconds) for punishment trials.
Second-stage choice onset time (in milliseconds) for punishment trials.
Trial win for punishment trials.
Trial number for reward trials.
First-stage choice selection for reward trials.
First-stage choice reaction time (in seconds) for reward trials.
First-stage stimulus onset time (in milliseconds) for reward trials.
First-stage choice onset time (in milliseconds) for reward trials.
Determination of which planet is presented.
Notes: 2 = one set of planets; 3 = a different set of planets; 888 = missing

ElementDescription: Second-stage choice selection for reward trials.
Second-stage choice reaction time (in seconds) for reward trials.
Second-stage stimulus onset time (in milliseconds) for reward trials.
Second-stage choice onset time (in milliseconds) for reward trials.
Trial win for reward trials.
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
